title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marton Kovacs. Maintainer, author. Don van Ravenzwaaij. Contributor, author. Rink Hoekstra. Contributor. Balazs Aczel. Contributor. Sebastian Lortz. Contributor, author. Andrew Setiono. Contributor, author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kovacs M, van Ravenzwaaij D, Hoekstra R, Aczel B (2021). “SampleSizePlanner: Tool Estimate Justify Sample Size.” https://github.com/marton-balazs-kovacs/SampleSizePlanner.
code: @Misc{kovacsvanravenzwaaij,   title = {SampleSizePlanner: A Tool to Estimate and Justify Sample Size},   author = {Marton Kovacs and Don {van Ravenzwaaij} and Rink Hoekstra and Balazs Aczel},   year = {2021},   url = {https://github.com/marton-balazs-kovacs/SampleSizePlanner},   abstract = {The SampleSizePlanner R package (and shiny application) enables researchers to calculate the sample size for different study desings. The aim of the package is to make the various sample size calculating methods available and propagate the transparent reporting of the chosen method.},   version = {0.1.0}, }

what: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: goal SampleSizePlanner help researchers determine sample size two group designs. present application R package offers 9 different sample size planning methods. addition, web application allows users create justification report sample size plan.

title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: Two One‐Sided Tests (TOST) Interval Equivalence Bayes factor Classical power analysis Power curve Bayes Factor Design Analysis (BFDA) Predetermined sample size Bayes factor Accuracy Parameter Estimation (AIPE) -priori precision (APP) Region Practical Equivalence (ROPE) Non-inferiority Bayes factor

title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: SampleSizePlanner can used either via web app via R.

title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: can use app https://martonbalazskovacs.shinyapps.io/SampleSizePlanner/. can alternatively run app locally computer following instructions: Install development version (SampleSizePlanner available CRAN) GitHub : Running app.

title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: can use R package determine sample size 9 methods present web app. However, possible currently generate justification report R package. Please see tutorial paper web app example sample size justifications method. tutorial paper two-group study designs can found .

title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: Please cite SampleSizePlanner use determining sample size. cite SampleSizePlanner software, use: Kovacs M, van Ravenzwaaij D, Hoekstra R, Aczel B (2021). “SampleSizePlanner: Tool Estimate Justify Sample Size.” https://github.com/marton-balazs-kovacs/SampleSizePlanner. copy reference information BibTeX file: cite tutorial paper two-group designs use: Kovacs, M., van Ravenzwaaij, D., Hoekstra, R., & Aczel, B. (2022). SampleSizePlanner: tool estimate justify sample size two-group studies. Advances Methods Practices Psychological Science, 5(1), 25152459211054059.
code: @Misc{kovacsvanravenzwaaij,   title = {SampleSizePlanner: A Tool to Estimate and Justify Sample Size},   author = {Marton Kovacs and Don {van Ravenzwaaij} and Rink Hoekstra and Balazs Aczel},   year = {2021},   url = {https://github.com/marton-balazs-kovacs/SampleSizePlanner},   abstract = {The SampleSizePlanner R package (and shiny application) enables researchers to calculate the sample size for different study desings. The aim of the package is to make the various sample size calculating methods available and propagate the transparent reporting of the chosen method.},   version = {0.1.0}, }

title: Application to Select the Fitting Sample Size Planning Method
text: open new ideas feature requests. Please note SampleSizePlanner project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Bayesian ANOVA Pre calculation Results — bayes_anova_data
title: Bayesian ANOVA Pre calculation Results — bayes_anova_data
text: Data set contains pre calculated sample sizes Bayesian ANOVA 2*2 designs. 1000 iterations per conditions used. maximum sample size per group set 500. data set contains input output values calculations.

title: Bayesian ANOVA Pre calculation Results — bayes_anova_data
Bayesian ANOVA Pre calculation Results — bayes_anova_data
text: dataframe 5550 rows 17 variables: filename character, name file. batch_id numeric, unique id batch calculation run parallel calculation_id numeric, unique id calculation within batch n1 numeric, determined sample size per group. tpr_out numeric, desired long-run probability HDI fully falling inside ROPE, given means. tpr_in numeric, desired long-run probability HDI fully falling inside ROPE, given means. prior_scale numeric, scale Cauchy prior fixed 1 / sqrt(2) ShinyApp. error_message character, error message case error. result_not_null logical, Whether precalculation led error . effect character, effect interest (main effect , main effect B). mu numeric, mean DV group. thresh numeric, threshold Bayes Factor fixed 10 ShinyApp. prior_location numeric, location Cauchy prior fixed 0. sigma numeric, standard deviation DV groups.

title: Bayesian ANOVA Pre calculation Results — bayes_anova_data
text: none pre calculated values suit sample size   determination plan, feel free calculations R package   using ssp_anova_bf function.

Bayes Factor Design Analysis Precalculation Results — bfda_precalculation_results
text: dataframe 3690 rows 9 variables: iterate numeric, unique id iteration tpr numeric, long-run probability obtaining Bayes factor least high critical threshold favoring superiority, given Delta. delta numeric, expected population effect size. thresh numeric, Bayes factor threshold inference. Either 3, 6, 10. prior_scale numeric, Scale Cauchy prior distribution. Either 1/sqrt(2), 1, sqrt(2). n1 numeric, determined sample size per group. tpr_out numeric, TPR associated resulting sample sizes. h0 numeric, frequency Bayes factor providing evidence null hypothesis given threshold. ha numeric, frequency Bayes factor providing evidence alternative hypothesis given threshold. error_message character, error message case error.

text: none precalculated values suit sample size   determination plan, feel free calculations R package   using ssp_bfda function.

title: Informed t-test functions — informed_t_test_functions
text: Functions created calculate Bayes factor informed priors t-tests. functions created Gronau, Q. F., Ly, ., & Wagenmakers, E. J. (2019). Informed Bayesian t-tests. American Statistician. paper. functions retrieved OSF.

title: Informed t-test functions — informed_t_test_functions
code: integrand_t(delta, t, n, nu, mu.delta, gamma, kappa)  posterior_t(   delta,   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.location,   prior.scale,   prior.df,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  cdf_t(   x,   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.location,   prior.scale,   prior.df,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  quantile_t(   q,   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.location,   prior.scale,   prior.df,   tol = 1e-04,   max.iter = 100,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  ciPlusMedian_t(   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.location,   prior.scale,   prior.df,   ci = 0.95,   type = "two-sided",   tol = 1e-04,   max.iter = 100,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  posterior_normal(   delta,   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.mean,   prior.variance )  cdf_normal(   x,   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.mean,   prior.variance,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  quantile_normal(   q,   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.mean,   prior.variance,   tol = 1e-04,   max.iter = 100,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  ciPlusMedian_normal(   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.mean,   prior.variance,   ci = 0.95,   type = "two-sided",   tol = 1e-04,   max.iter = 100,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  bf10_t(   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.location,   prior.scale,   prior.df,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )  bf10_normal(   t,   n1,   n2 = NULL,   independentSamples = FALSE,   prior.mean,   prior.variance,   rel.tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.25 )

title: Determine sample size with Bayesian Anova method — ssp_anova_bf
text: effect Character. effect interest (main effect , main effect B, interaction effect). mu Numeric.  mean DV group. tpr Numeric. long-run probability obtaining Bayes factor least high critical threshold favoring superiority, given mu. thresh Integer. Bayes factor threshold inference. prior_scale Numeric. Scale Cauchy prior distribution. iter Integer. number iterations. max_n Integer. maximum number participants per group (groups assumed equal sample size). max_bf Numeric. maximum Bayes Factor value reduce computation time. Bayes Factors first 10 iterations exceeded max_bf, set TPR equal 1 proceeded next sample size. sigma Numeric. standard deviation DV groups. seed Numeric. seed reproducibility. n Numeric. sample size per group tpr optimization process. n1 Numeric. sample size per group tpr optimization process.
